qas.question: Which publication said Nintendo's best console ever was the SNES?
Which writer said the SNES was the best console ever from any company?
Where did GameTrailers rank the SNES among all consoles?
Who said the SNES was "simply the most timeless system ever created"?
Where did IGN rank the SNES?

plausible_answers.text: its graphic, sound, and library of top-quality games

qas.question: Why did GameTrailers name the SNES second-best console of all time in 2008?

plausible_answers.text: the greatest console of all time

qas.question: What did Will Greenwald proclaim about the Playstation in 2009?
Who said the Playstation was simply the most timeless system ever created?

plausible_answers.text: for its graphics, audio, controllers, and games

qas.question: Why did Big N. Technology rate the Playstation fifth of ten?

plausible_answers.text: the fourth best video game console

qas.question: In 2007 how did GamingExcellence rate the NES?

context: In 2007, <a0_0>GameTrailers<a0_0/> named the SNES as the <a2_0>second-best<a2_0/> console of all time in their list of top ten consoles that "left their mark on the history of gaming", citing <b5_0>its graphic, sound, and library of top-quality games<b5_0/>. In 2015, they also named it the best Nintendo console of all time, saying, "The list of games we love from this console completely annihilates any other roster from the Big N." Technology columnist <a1_0>Don Reisinger<a1_0/> proclaimed "The SNES is <b6_0>the greatest console of all time<b6_0/>" in January 2008, citing the quality of the games and the console's dramatic improvement over its predecessor; fellow technology columnist Will Greenwald replied with a more nuanced view, giving the SNES top marks with his heart, the NES with his head, and the PlayStation (for its controller) with his hands. <a3_0><b7_0>GamingExcellence<b7_0/><a3_0/> also gave the SNES first place in 2008, declaring it "simply the most timeless system ever created" with many games that stand the test of time and citing its innovation in controller design, graphics capabilities, and game storytelling. At the same time, GameDaily rated it fifth of ten <b8_0>for its graphics, audio, controllers, and games<b8_0/>. In 2009, IGN named the Super Nintendo Entertainment System <b9_0>the <a4_0>fourth best<a4_0/> video game console<b9_0/>, complimenting its audio and "concentration of AAA titles".
